name: TheAtlantic
text: "I ran away from institutional racism; I cannot watch while my adopted country moves toward it now," Hirsh Goodman writes: https://t.co/XHQXRVNeUQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Baldwin put his whole life and body weight into these words, which, today more than ever, reverberate like a never-ending nightmare." Raoul Peck, the director of "I Am Not Your Negro," writes about heeding James Baldwin, more than 50 years later: https://t.co/oeORaYmI97

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Books Briefing: The influential role of platonic intimacy. https://t.co/hncEABHsk6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Flesh-eating bacteria are on the rise in the beach towns near Melbourne, Australia, and scientists are struggling to figure out why, @bborrell reports. https://t.co/Sgia2TGYem

name: TheAtlantic
text: Real revolutions are a surprise, @RebeccaSpang writes. "Revolutions happen when the distinct concerns of many different groups are for a time more or less soldered together—and this coming together is … produced largely by chance." https://t.co/Ebm5zBVdxD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Feeling cavalier, the first thing we did on Sunday in Reykjavík was go to the playground. It felt like the first playground we had been to in forever," Adam Roy Gordon writes: https://t.co/y14Ji0xix2

name: TheAtlantic
text: This year, the Fourth of July is being greeted with mixed feelings. Here’s our guide to observing this strange day. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy and @haleysweiss: https://t.co/RrJQuyjfRe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "[W. E. B.] Du Bois’s 1920 book, 'Darkwater: Voices From Within the Veil,' offers us a clarion call to action, to imagine a better tomorrow and continue, even in the face of death, to live, to fight, and to love," @Dr_ChadWilliams writes: https://t.co/34C95HQ953

name: TheAtlantic
text: The boogaloo boys are yet another example of a meme escaping from 4chan to become a real-life extremist movement, @DaleBeran writes. https://t.co/lgBFHcGlOo

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @thebanderson: “It’s not that there is any activity with absolutely zero risk, but the beach may well be as good as it gets,” @zeynep writes: https://t.co/ypcNvjFkQd

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Furious scolding about the least risky part of a potentially risky chain of activities is certain to backfire." Read @zeynep's latest:   https://t.co/m6lbxwumq2

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "As with the alt-right, many boogaloo posts are about men in crisis, humiliated or debased. Intermingled with memes about revolution are nostalgic images and video clips, glitched out to look like old VHS tapes..."
https://t.co/JXHSTEWSnK

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: “The way many think of custodial staff does not reflect the value that they provide to hospitals," @RepMarkTakano told @jasper_craven recently. “They are critical to infection control; we need to see these employees as skilled workers.” https://t.co/F65Ul7oMba

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is the most cogent explanation yet of the boogaloo phenomenon. Yet another example of a 4chan meme that turned into an extremist movement. Read @DaleBeran: https://t.co/cS4Fiq6JMQ
